name: Multi Recipient Router
helpText: The router will allow the payload to be sent conditionally alone one or more optional routes.

componentName.helpText: The name of the component as displayed on diagrams, space are encouraged, succinct is best. The name should be unique for the flow.

userImplementedClassName.helpText: The name of the class that contain the logic to decide which route a payload will be delivered to, the IDE will create a template for this class, the user  must provide the implementation.
userImplementedClassName.validationMessage: Provide a valid java classname for the router e.g. starting with upper case, followed by number/characters etc.

configuration.helpText: Provide the bean type that contains bespoke configurations for this component.
configuration.validationMessage: Provide a java classname for the Configuration bean.

configuredResource.helpText: Allow the Configuration to be exposed in the Ikasan console.

configuredResourceId.helpText: By default, the configuration ID = modulename + flowname + componentName + componentType. There are times when you may wish to override this i.e. if you want multiple flows to share the same configration or you have changed a flow name but don't want to update properties that may have already been stored in the override properties database.

fromType.helpText: The type of data we expect to come into the router. This can be any Java class.
fromType.validationMessage: Provide a fully qualified Java class name to be used as the type for the input to the router.

routeNames.helpText: The commma seperated list of names to identify the different routes
routeNames.validationMessage: Provide a comma seperated list of route names.
